content: in a legal case in estonia the pärnu county court ruled that the defendant is responsible for half of the claimants procedural costs the total cost awarded to the claimant was €483 the case involved two parties referred to as tp and ta who were demanding the division of a common property the court decided to satisfy the claim and terminate the property association the property will be sold at a public auction and the profit will be divided equally between tp and ta the court also explained the requirements for procedural assistance and the deadline for filing a complaint the original text refers to specific articles of the legal code the case started in 2022 and was transferred to the pärnu county court the defendant objected to the lawsuit and claimed the right to continue living in the apartment with their children the court scheduled a preliminary hearing for may 10 2022 in june 2022 the defendant failed to attend a court hearing so the claimant requested a default judgment the court accepted the claimants statements and dismissed the claim the court determined that the claimant and defendant should each bear half of the procedural costs the defendant objected to the amount but the court found it justified the decision on procedural costs can be appealed
